programme.title: Flaming Star (1960)
programme.desc: The son of a Native American mother and a white father faces a test of loyalties when he is caught on the racial divide as a Kiowa tribe go on the warpath and white settlers carry out brutal reprisal attacks. Whereas he is drawn to side with his mother's people, his half-brother takes the opposing view. Western, starring Elvis Presley, Steve Forrest, Barbara Eden, Richard Jaeckel and Dolores Del Rio

programme.title: Flame of the Barbary Coast (1945)
programme.desc: A cattle rancher falls for a San Francisco saloon-bar singer, but she proves to be in cahoots with a ruthless card sharp who wins all his money. Not to be outdone, he sets out to hone his card-playing skills for a rematch, unaware the city is poised on the brink of disaster. Romantic drama, starring John Wayne, Ann Dvorak and Joseph Schildkraut

programme.desc:

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
Inspector Anton Sullivan is on the hunt for an escaped prisoner who is believed to be a high risk to the public, with a drone and dog handlers helping in the search. Anton is then called to a serious collision on the M56 involving a motorcyclist and multiple vehicles, while PC Niaz Waddington deals with boy racers who are weaving through traffic and speeding on the motorway
S03E01

programme.title: Trucking Heavy

programme.title: Posse from Hell (1961)
programme.desc: Bandits invade a frontier town, rob the bank, kill the sheriff and kidnap a local woman. A tough gunslinger who was a friend of the dead lawman takes on the job of bringing them to justice, but the only one of the townspeople willing to help is a naive banker determined to prove his worth. Western, starring Audie Murphy, John Saxon, Vic Morrow and Lee Van Cleef

programme.desc: A gunslinging gambler is thrown out of an isolated frontier town for his improper behaviour. He returns to warn the unsuspecting settlers of an impending attack by a band of Apaches fighting to regain possession of their lost territory - but struggles to convince them of the danger. Western, starring Stephen McNally, Willard Parker, Coleen Gray and Arthur Shields

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Officers pursue a driver who flees the scene of a road accident in a decommissioned ambulance, eventually abandoning the vehicle on a railway line after crashing through level-crossing barriers. Elsewhere, Warren comes under attack from a gang of youths on a garage forecourt, Spenner nicks a runaway driver with the help of a wheelie bin, and Kev is faced with a flaming Mercedes in the middle of rush hour
S16E08

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
In North Yorkshire, more than a thousand drink-drivers are arrested every year meaning police are always looking out for suspicious cars and drivers taking their chances. Near Wetherby, a pursuit of a suspected drug driver reaches speeds of 130 mph before it ends with a head-on smash with a police car, while police receive reports that a driver has crashed his car down an embankment into a holiday home near Scarborough and fled the scene. Suspicions run high when a driver collides with a motorbike and then downs pints of beer in his local pub straight after the accident
S12E19

programme.title: HMP Belmarsh: Maximum Security
programme.desc: A look inside HMP Belmarsh prison, from the gangs that have dominated its corridors to the brave officers who serve there, and some of the prison's most infamous inmates. The documentary brings to life in graphic detail the vicious conflicts and unthinkable acts of violence that are part of daily life inside Belmarsh, offering a harrowing insight into what life is really like in the prison

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed
S06E04

programme.title: Police: Night Shift 999
programme.desc:
A car is stolen in Gloucester and then crashed by a pair of youths. Traffic officer PC Merchant and the firearms unit set out to track down the culprits, but it proves to be harder than expected. Elsewhere, PCs Hayes and Cooper help a night worker in a petrol station, after he is shockingly attacked by one of his customers
S02E08

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Gordon Morris leads a raid on the house of a suspected drug user, but the door won't budge. Meanwhile, Rich Woodward is in pursuit of a souped-up hot hatch, a late-night reveller kicks off in Nantwich town centre, and police dog Bonnie is used in the hunt for two runaways
S12E03

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
999: Criminals: Caught on Camera: Documentary in which journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. Here he exposes the rise in ram raids across the UK, with footage of two masked men using a 4x4 to pull the front off a cash machine at the University of East Anglia in Norwich. Nick also shows how detectives used laser-scanning technology to recreate a crime scene and close in on a gang that terrorised West Yorkshire pub owners in 2013
S03E01

programme.title: Seconds from Death: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Crazes: Clip series showing just how deadly life can be. This episode looks at extreme sports, including footage of how an extreme skier's worst nightmare unfolded
S01E02

programme.title: When Buildings Collapse: World's Worst Engineering Disasters
programme.desc: Rob Bell investigates some terrible engineering disasters. In 2018, a Miami bridge collapsed killed six people, leaving investigators wondering what turned the $11million structure into a lethal object. Six months later, 43 people were killed when a bridge in Genoa also failed. Back in 1981, the atrium of a new hotel in Kansas City crashed to the ground, costing over 100 lives. Rob discovers how a change in the design of the walkways was responsible. Despite the sad fact that design flaws and construction errors cost lives, Rob reveals how such occurrences also teach engineers how to save them

programme.title: The Big Country (1958)
programme.desc: A naive sea captain learns a harsh lesson in cowboy lore when he becomes embroiled in a family feud. Tensions are running high between his future father-in-law and a hillbilly clan over the thorny issue of water rights - and neither party is impressed by the newcomer when he refuses to take sides. Western, starring Gregory Peck, Charlton Heston, Jean Simmons, Burl Ives and Carroll Baker

Disaster movie, starring Sylvester Stallone, Amy Brenneman, Viggo Mortensen, Dan Hedaya and Claire Bloom

programme.desc:

programme.desc: A look inside HMP Belmarsh prison, from the gangs that have dominated its corridors to the brave officers who serve there, and some of the prison's most infamous inmates. programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: 11/05/2023: Naga Munchetty and Charlie Stayt present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Sam Quek and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc:
Rav Wilding and YouTuber Jim Browning join forces with ethical hackers to hunt down cyber criminals. Using the same remote-access technology that criminals use to scam their victims, the team hacks the hackers and monitors their operation
S02E09

programme.title: Maximum Security
programme.desc:
Dom Littlewood is at Heathrow, where he checks out the security around air freight and gets special access to the Border Force warehouses where they keep goods seized by customs. Security expert Sukie Madahar has advice on how to keep pets safe from thieves
S01E09

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc:
Jacqui Joseph boards a ferry to view a traditional cottage in Ventnor on the Isle of Wight, while Dion Dublin checks out an end-terrace in Bradford as well as following a two-year project in Derby to build eight homes on land formerly used as garages and workshops
S26E22

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc:
Builth Wells 6: Charlie Ross presents from the Royal Welsh Showground in Builth Wells, Powys, as Richard Madley and Kate Bliss help the teams look for items to sell at auction. Charlie also meets Jen Jones, a collector of Welsh quilts, before joining the teams in Malvern for the auction
S54E07

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc:
Islands: Bear receives an offer, the fate of The Beechwalk is decided and Scarlett has an idea. A mum struggling to put food on the table lets pride get in the way of helping her son - with potentially fatal consequences
S24E62

programme.title: Countryfile Spring Diaries
programme.desc:
Countryfile Diaries: Jules Hudson investigates why half of the UK's dogs are obese, Margherita Taylor uncovers a way to avoid sending 300,000 tons of clothing to landfill and John Craven visits Broughton Castle in Oxfordshire
S04E04

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc:
North Yorkshire: Having fallen head over heels with North Yorkshire, a retired teacher and her pet bunny Gary need Nicki Chapman's help with finding a new home for Â£450,000, from which to fully explore this beautiful county. Sausages are on the menu too, as Nicki helps to make and then taste a vegan banger
S22E24

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc:
The dealers bid against each other on items including a vintage train set, a set of mid-century chairs, a 1940s style microphone, and an old butchers block
S02E22

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc:
Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford
S03E29

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc:

S28E04

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Linda is shocked to find The Vic has been broken into and trashed. Rocky calls an old friend when Sonia pulls out of the special performance he is doing for Kathy's party. Kim is in turmoil after court but refuses to talk to Howie and Ben takes things too far

programme.title: Eurovision Song Contest
programme.desc: Alesha Dixon, Hannah Waddingham and Julia Sanina host the second semi-final live from Liverpool, with Rylan and Scott Mills on commentary duty. programme.title: Maximum Security

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc:

S23E02

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc:
Eurovision Special: Natasha Raskin Sharp hosts, as former Eurovision stars Cheryl Baker, SuRie, Carrie Grant and Andy Abraham compete to buy and sell items for profit. Experts Charles Hanson and Thomas Forrester assist the contenders, while Natasha also dips into the world of Eurovision collectibles and looks back at some of the contest's memorable moments, from its launch in 1956 to the global phenomenon it is today
S01E14

programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc:
Still reeling from the state she found her dad in last night, Niamh suggests he might be suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder following his car crash. Meanwhile, a blues festival take a sinister when a woman arrested for driving while intoxicated claims that she was spiked
S02E08

programme.title: Countryfile Spring Diaries
programme.desc:
Countryfile Diaries: Jules Hudson visits a charity that helps to rehome bereaved pets, Paul Martin meets a community who are determined save the last native British daffodil and Ellie Harrison explores some tree houses for grown-ups
S04E05

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc:
Perth and Kinross: Alistair Appleton travels to rural Perth and Kinross on a mission to help a young couple from Edinburgh realise their dream of a new lifestyle in a rural home
S22E02

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc:
Nigel Havers welcomes five more sellers to the Bidding Room, where they try to sell items to five professional dealers who are on the lookout for interesting pieces, with help from expert Simon Bower. Here, dealers Adi, Melissa, JB, Moses, Lucy, Samantha and Ian bid against one another on a set of mid-century cinema-style seats, Victorian wooden spinning tops, a silver cigarette case, a creepy head-shaped pot and an iconic 1960s movie poster
S02E24

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc:

programme.title: BBC News at Six
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: The One Show at Eurovision: Alex Jones and Rylan look ahead to the Eurovision Grand Final and pop star Mika meets some of the people behind the biggest Eurovision hits

programme.title: Eurovision Song Contest - Everyone's a Winner
programme.desc: Taking top spot at Eurovision guarantees fame and fortune - but failing to win is no bar to success either. Fleur East and a panel of celebrity Eurovision super-fans toast the 20 most successful Eurovision songs that didn't win. These are entrants whose songs have gone on to rack up millions of internet views and streams worldwide. Contributors include Claire Sweeney, Scott Mills and Paddy O'Connell

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
The last quarter-final sees the week's most talented four cooks return to fight for a place in Knockout Week. They must prepare two courses that will impress not just regular judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also from the 2014 series Ping Coombes, the 2015 series Simon Wood and 2020 series finalist Claire Fyfe
S19E15

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc:
Comedy actress Diane Morgan hosts, as comedian Desiree Burch and journalist and Times Radio presenter Matt Chorley join in the fun on the satirical current affairs quiz, alongside regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton
S65E05

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc:
Undercover police officers Dom and Kay are in a mess - frightened and on their own they have Clinton's body to bury. Dom recalls that Clinton said he was 'protected' and reasons that someone else must know about this mission. They decide to head to Clinton's house, but on the way bump into fellow PCSO Kieran Price who questions their very shaky story about why they're caked in mud. Clinton's house yields an interesting discovery - but Dom and Kay are not the only ones breaking in. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo, Hammed Animashaun and Colin Hoult
S01E02

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show
programme.desc:
The married couple welcome guests including comedian Joel Dommett and model Hannah Cooper - plus members of the public - to poke fun at life, relationships, annoyances, parenting and absolutely everything in-between. Featuring Please Keep Me Anonymous, where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one refuses to remove from the house

programme.title: The Monuments Men (2014)

programme.desc: False Diagnosis: The ADHD Scandal - Panorama: There has been a sharp increase in the number of adults who think they have attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. The NHS has been overwhelmed, and thousands are turning to private clinics for assessment instead. Rory Carson poses as a patient to reveal some clinics charging large fees for a short online consultation, and evidence suggesting diagnoses are being handed out to almost everyone who books an appointment. The programme also reveals clinics prescribing powerful drugs without carrying out proper checks

How a young couple's new glamping business was threatened when their Instagram account was hacked into and taken over. The hacker demanded $500 to hand back control - but they stood their ground. Incidents like this are increasingly common, with more than half of small businesses suffering a cyberattack in the last 12 months. Rav Wilding looks at the work being done by West Midlands Cybercrime Unit to combat the problem
S03E04

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
A painting depicting the Lebanese city of Beirut arrives at the barn. It was painted by Nonny Jackson-Twist's grandfather just after the Second World War. He would very much like to hang the painting in his home, but it's faded, the canvas cracked and in some sections the paint is flaking away. However, fine art conservator Lucia Scalisi is only too happy to take on this monumental task. Also being restored are pair of silver Shabbat candlesticks and a dilapidated car jack. Presented by Jay Blades
S09E09

They decide to head to Clinton's house, but on the way bump into fellow PCSO Kieran Price who questions their very shaky story about why they're caked in mud. programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: False Diagnosis: The ADHD Scandal - Panorama: There has been a sharp increase in the number of adults who think they have attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. The NHS has been overwhelmed, and thousands are turning to private clinics for assessment instead. Rory Carson poses as a patient to reveal some clinics charging large fees for a short online consultation, and evidence suggesting diagnoses are being handed out to almost everyone who books an appointment. The programme also reveals clinics prescribing powerful drugs without carrying out proper checks

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Rav Wilding uses cutting-edge technology to monitor scammers' phone calls, to try and stop the victims losing out to real-time scams. It's then a race against the criminals to contact the victim and intercept the scam before any money is handed over to the crooks. The show also explores the biggest anti-social issues troubling UK neighbourhoods and meets the local heroes using their own time and resources to tackle these problems head on

programme.title: Steeltown Murders
programme.desc:
As the CID reopen an investigation into three murders from 1973, DCI Paul Bethell tries to piece together a past that has haunted both him and a community for almost 30 years. As new advances in DNA technology provide the possibility of answers, Paul reflects on his time as a junior officer, when he became convinced that the murderer of a teenager would soon strike again. Crime drama, starring Philip Glenister

programme.title: Matt Willis: Fighting Addiction
programme.desc: Bassist and co-founder of Busted Matt Willis opens up about his experiences battling drug and alcohol addiction and his daily struggle to stay clean and sober. He speaks on the constant fear of relapse and the pressure it puts on himself and his family. Matt looks back on his past and his darkest days, trying to get to the root of his addictions. He visits a rehab unit that made a real difference to his recovery to speak with experts about why he and fellow addicts become dependent on drugs and alcohol before travelling to Imperial College London to meet a research team who are studying the differences in the brains of people with addictions and people without

They decide to head to Clinton's house, but on the way bump into fellow PCSO Kieran Price who questions their very shaky story about why they're caked in mud. programme.desc: False Diagnosis: The ADHD Scandal - Panorama: There has been a sharp increase in the number of adults who think they have attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. The NHS has been overwhelmed, and thousands are turning to private clinics for assessment instead. Rory Carson poses as a patient to reveal some clinics charging large fees for a short online consultation, and evidence suggesting diagnoses are being handed out to almost everyone who books an appointment. The programme also reveals clinics prescribing powerful drugs without carrying out proper checks

Horologist Steve Fletcher and leather expert Suzie Fletcher are brought a century-old watch by Nancy who's father was awarded the watch for his bravery on his return from the First World War. Upholsterer Sonnaz Nooranvary takes on a rocking chair that has been at the heart of Anna's family home for decades and is in desperate need of some TLC. Last into the shop is Ruth and her Auntie Roz who bring in a penny arcade game from the 1920s

programme.title: Matt Willis: Fighting Addiction
programme.desc: Bassist and co-founder of Busted Matt Willis opens up about his experiences battling drug and alcohol addiction and his daily struggle to stay clean and sober. He speaks on the constant fear of relapse and the pressure it puts on himself and his family. Matt looks back on his past and his darkest days, trying to get to the root of his addictions. He visits a rehab unit that made a real difference to his recovery to speak with experts about why he and fellow addicts become dependent on drugs and alcohol before travelling to Imperial College London to meet a research team who are studying the differences in the brains of people with addictions and people without

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
A painting depicting the Lebanese city of Beirut arrives at the barn. It was painted by Nonny Jackson-Twist's grandfather just after the Second World War. He would very much like to hang the painting in his home, but it's faded, the canvas cracked and in some sections the paint is flaking away. However, fine art conservator Lucia Scalisi is only too happy to take on this monumental task. Also being restored are pair of silver Shabbat candlesticks and a dilapidated car jack. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc:
Drama about British immigrants to Australia in the 1950s. In dreary post-war Manchester, Annie Roberts is at her wits end when husband Terry spends all his wages down the pub. Desperate for a better life for her children, Annie responds to an emigration advert that promises a prosperous new life in Australia. Expecting whitewashed houses and sun-soaked adventures, the Roberts family arrive in Sydney to find life down under isn't quite what they've been sold. Starring Faye Marsay and Michelle Keegan

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: False Diagnosis: The ADHD Scandal - Panorama: There has been a sharp increase in the number of adults who think they have attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. The NHS has been overwhelmed, and thousands are turning to private clinics for assessment instead. Rory Carson poses as a patient to reveal some clinics charging large fees for a short online consultation, and evidence suggesting diagnoses are being handed out to almost everyone who books an appointment. The programme also reveals clinics prescribing powerful drugs without carrying out proper checks

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Rav Wilding uses cutting-edge technology to monitor scammers' phone calls, to try and stop the victims losing out to real-time scams. It's then a race against the criminals to contact the victim and intercept the scam before any money is handed over to the crooks. The show also explores the biggest anti-social issues troubling UK neighbourhoods and meets the local heroes using their own time and resources to tackle these problems head on

programme.title: Steeltown Murders
programme.desc:
As the CID reopen an investigation into three murders from 1973, DCI Paul Bethell tries to piece together a past that has haunted both him and a community for almost 30 years. As new advances in DNA technology provide the possibility of answers, Paul reflects on his time as a junior officer, when he became convinced that the murderer of a teenager would soon strike again. programme.title: Matt Willis: Fighting Addiction
programme.desc: Bassist and co-founder of Busted Matt Willis opens up about his experiences battling drug and alcohol addiction and his daily struggle to stay clean and sober. He speaks on the constant fear of relapse and the pressure it puts on himself and his family. Matt looks back on his past and his darkest days, trying to get to the root of his addictions. He visits a rehab unit that made a real difference to his recovery to speak with experts about why he and fellow addicts become dependent on drugs and alcohol before travelling to Imperial College London to meet a research team who are studying the differences in the brains of people with addictions and people without

They decide to head to Clinton's house, but on the way bump into fellow PCSO Kieran Price who questions their very shaky story about why they're caked in mud. programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: False Diagnosis: The ADHD Scandal - Panorama: There has been a sharp increase in the number of adults who think they have attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. The NHS has been overwhelmed, and thousands are turning to private clinics for assessment instead. Rory Carson poses as a patient to reveal some clinics charging large fees for a short online consultation, and evidence suggesting diagnoses are being handed out to almost everyone who books an appointment. The programme also reveals clinics prescribing powerful drugs without carrying out proper checks

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Rav Wilding uses cutting-edge technology to monitor scammers' phone calls, to try and stop the victims losing out to real-time scams. It's then a race against the criminals to contact the victim and intercept the scam before any money is handed over to the crooks. The show also explores the biggest anti-social issues troubling UK neighbourhoods and meets the local heroes using their own time and resources to tackle these problems head on

programme.desc:
As the CID reopen an investigation into three murders from 1973, DCI Paul Bethell tries to piece together a past that has haunted both him and a community for almost 30 years. programme.title: Matt Willis: Fighting Addiction
programme.desc: Bassist and co-founder of Busted Matt Willis opens up about his experiences battling drug and alcohol addiction and his daily struggle to stay clean and sober. He speaks on the constant fear of relapse and the pressure it puts on himself and his family. Matt looks back on his past and his darkest days, trying to get to the root of his addictions. He visits a rehab unit that made a real difference to his recovery to speak with experts about why he and fellow addicts become dependent on drugs and alcohol before travelling to Imperial College London to meet a research team who are studying the differences in the brains of people with addictions and people without

programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Leeds United v Newcastle United at Elland Road and Aston Villa v Tottenham Hotspur at Villa Park. programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
Mental Health Awareness: For Mental Health Awareness Week, Charlotte Smith visits a Cornwall farm to see how their support programmes based on agriculture help people with mental and physical wellbeing. Marathon runner Haroon Mota goes hiking in Snowdonia, exploring why the great outdoors is so important to his mental wellbeing. Datshiane Navanayagam looks at the impact increasing debt is having on farmers, and Adam Henson reports on how women in agriculture are facing up to the mental health challenges of rural isolation

programme.title: British Academy Television Awards

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc:
Drama about British immigrants to Australia in the 1950s. In dreary post-war Manchester, Annie Roberts is at her wits end when husband Terry spends all his wages down the pub. Desperate for a better life for her children, Annie responds to an emigration advert that promises a prosperous new life in Australia. Expecting whitewashed houses and sun-soaked adventures, the Roberts family arrive in Sydney to find life down under isn't quite what they've been sold. Starring Faye Marsay and Michelle Keegan

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: False Diagnosis: The ADHD Scandal - Panorama: There has been a sharp increase in the number of adults who think they have attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. The NHS has been overwhelmed, and thousands are turning to private clinics for assessment instead. Rory Carson poses as a patient to reveal some clinics charging large fees for a short online consultation, and evidence suggesting diagnoses are being handed out to almost everyone who books an appointment. The programme also reveals clinics prescribing powerful drugs without carrying out proper checks

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Rav Wilding uses cutting-edge technology to monitor scammers' phone calls, to try and stop the victims losing out to real-time scams. It's then a race against the criminals to contact the victim and intercept the scam before any money is handed over to the crooks. The show also explores the biggest anti-social issues troubling UK neighbourhoods and meets the local heroes using their own time and resources to tackle these problems head on

programme.title: Steeltown Murders
programme.desc:
As the CID reopen an investigation into three murders from 1973, DCI Paul Bethell tries to piece together a past that has haunted both him and a community for almost 30 years. As new advances in DNA technology provide the possibility of answers, Paul reflects on his time as a junior officer, when he became convinced that the murderer of a teenager would soon strike again. Crime drama, starring Philip Glenister

programme.title: Matt Willis: Fighting Addiction
programme.desc: Bassist and co-founder of Busted Matt Willis opens up about his experiences battling drug and alcohol addiction and his daily struggle to stay clean and sober. He speaks on the constant fear of relapse and the pressure it puts on himself and his family. Matt looks back on his past and his darkest days, trying to get to the root of his addictions. He visits a rehab unit that made a real difference to his recovery to speak with experts about why he and fellow addicts become dependent on drugs and alcohol before travelling to Imperial College London to meet a research team who are studying the differences in the brains of people with addictions and people without

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: False Diagnosis: The ADHD Scandal - Panorama: There has been a sharp increase in the number of adults who think they have attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. The NHS has been overwhelmed, and thousands are turning to private clinics for assessment instead. Rory Carson poses as a patient to reveal some clinics charging large fees for a short online consultation, and evidence suggesting diagnoses are being handed out to almost everyone who books an appointment. The programme also reveals clinics prescribing powerful drugs without carrying out proper checks

programme.title: Matt Willis: Fighting Addiction
programme.desc: Bassist and co-founder of Busted Matt Willis opens up about his experiences battling drug and alcohol addiction and his daily struggle to stay clean and sober. He speaks on the constant fear of relapse and the pressure it puts on himself and his family. Matt looks back on his past and his darkest days, trying to get to the root of his addictions. He visits a rehab unit that made a real difference to his recovery to speak with experts about why he and fellow addicts become dependent on drugs and alcohol before travelling to Imperial College London to meet a research team who are studying the differences in the brains of people with addictions and people without

Expecting whitewashed houses and sun-soaked adventures, the Roberts family arrive in Sydney to find life down under isn't quite what they've been sold. Starring Faye Marsay and Michelle Keegan

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: False Diagnosis: The ADHD Scandal - Panorama: There has been a sharp increase in the number of adults who think they have attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. The NHS has been overwhelmed, and thousands are turning to private clinics for assessment instead. Rory Carson poses as a patient to reveal some clinics charging large fees for a short online consultation, and evidence suggesting diagnoses are being handed out to almost everyone who books an appointment. The programme also reveals clinics prescribing powerful drugs without carrying out proper checks

programme.desc: Rav Wilding uses cutting-edge technology to monitor scammers' phone calls, to try and stop the victims losing out to real-time scams. It's then a race against the criminals to contact the victim and intercept the scam before any money is handed over to the crooks. The show also explores the biggest anti-social issues troubling UK neighbourhoods and meets the local heroes using their own time and resources to tackle these problems head on

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: False Diagnosis: The ADHD Scandal - Panorama: There has been a sharp increase in the number of adults who think they have attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. The NHS has been overwhelmed, and thousands are turning to private clinics for assessment instead. Rory Carson poses as a patient to reveal some clinics charging large fees for a short online consultation, and evidence suggesting diagnoses are being handed out to almost everyone who books an appointment. The programme also reveals clinics prescribing powerful drugs without carrying out proper checks

programme.title: Matt Willis: Fighting Addiction
programme.desc: Bassist and co-founder of Busted Matt Willis opens up about his experiences battling drug and alcohol addiction and his daily struggle to stay clean and sober. He speaks on the constant fear of relapse and the pressure it puts on himself and his family. Matt looks back on his past and his darkest days, trying to get to the root of his addictions. He visits a rehab unit that made a real difference to his recovery to speak with experts about why he and fellow addicts become dependent on drugs and alcohol before travelling to Imperial College London to meet a research team who are studying the differences in the brains of people with addictions and people without

programme.desc: False Diagnosis: The ADHD Scandal - Panorama: There has been a sharp increase in the number of adults who think they have attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. The NHS has been overwhelmed, and thousands are turning to private clinics for assessment instead. Rory Carson poses as a patient to reveal some clinics charging large fees for a short online consultation, and evidence suggesting diagnoses are being handed out to almost everyone who books an appointment. The programme also reveals clinics prescribing powerful drugs without carrying out proper checks

programme.desc: Bassist and co-founder of Busted Matt Willis opens up about his experiences battling drug and alcohol addiction and his daily struggle to stay clean and sober. He visits a rehab unit that made a real difference to his recovery to speak with experts about why he and fellow addicts become dependent on drugs and alcohol before travelling to Imperial College London to meet a research team who are studying the differences in the brains of people with addictions and people without

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
A painting depicting the Lebanese city of Beirut arrives at the barn. It was painted by Nonny Jackson-Twist's grandfather just after the Second World War. He would very much like to hang the painting in his home, but it's faded, the canvas cracked and in some sections the paint is flaking away. However, fine art conservator Lucia Scalisi is only too happy to take on this monumental task. Also being restored are pair of silver Shabbat candlesticks and a dilapidated car jack. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: False Diagnosis: The ADHD Scandal - Panorama: There has been a sharp increase in the number of adults who think they have attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. The NHS has been overwhelmed, and thousands are turning to private clinics for assessment instead. Rory Carson poses as a patient to reveal some clinics charging large fees for a short online consultation, and evidence suggesting diagnoses are being handed out to almost everyone who books an appointment. The programme also reveals clinics prescribing powerful drugs without carrying out proper checks

programme.desc: Rav Wilding uses cutting-edge technology to monitor scammers' phone calls, to try and stop the victims losing out to real-time scams. programme.title: Steeltown Murders

programme.title: Matt Willis: Fighting Addiction
programme.desc: Bassist and co-founder of Busted Matt Willis opens up about his experiences battling drug and alcohol addiction and his daily struggle to stay clean and sober. He speaks on the constant fear of relapse and the pressure it puts on himself and his family. Matt looks back on his past and his darkest days, trying to get to the root of his addictions. He visits a rehab unit that made a real difference to his recovery to speak with experts about why he and fellow addicts become dependent on drugs and alcohol before travelling to Imperial College London to meet a research team who are studying the differences in the brains of people with addictions and people without

Dom recalls that Clinton said he was 'protected' and reasons that someone else must know about this mission. They decide to head to Clinton's house, but on the way bump into fellow PCSO Kieran Price who questions their very shaky story about why they're caked in mud. Clinton's house yields an interesting discovery - but Dom and Kay are not the only ones breaking in. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo, Hammed Animashaun and Colin Hoult

programme.desc: False Diagnosis: The ADHD Scandal - Panorama: There has been a sharp increase in the number of adults who think they have attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. Rory Carson poses as a patient to reveal some clinics charging large fees for a short online consultation, and evidence suggesting diagnoses are being handed out to almost everyone who books an appointment. The programme also reveals clinics prescribing powerful drugs without carrying out proper checks

How a young couple's new glamping business was threatened when their Instagram account was hacked into and taken over. The hacker demanded $500 to hand back control - but they stood their ground. Incidents like this are increasingly common, with more than half of small businesses suffering a cyberattack in the last 12 months. Rav Wilding looks at the work being done by West Midlands Cybercrime Unit to combat the problem

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
A painting depicting the Lebanese city of Beirut arrives at the barn. It was painted by Nonny Jackson-Twist's grandfather just after the Second World War. He would very much like to hang the painting in his home, but it's faded, the canvas cracked and in some sections the paint is flaking away. However, fine art conservator Lucia Scalisi is only too happy to take on this monumental task. Also being restored are pair of silver Shabbat candlesticks and a dilapidated car jack. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: False Diagnosis: The ADHD Scandal - Panorama: There has been a sharp increase in the number of adults who think they have attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. The NHS has been overwhelmed, and thousands are turning to private clinics for assessment instead. Rory Carson poses as a patient to reveal some clinics charging large fees for a short online consultation, and evidence suggesting diagnoses are being handed out to almost everyone who books an appointment. The programme also reveals clinics prescribing powerful drugs without carrying out proper checks

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Rav Wilding uses cutting-edge technology to monitor scammers' phone calls, to try and stop the victims losing out to real-time scams. It's then a race against the criminals to contact the victim and intercept the scam before any money is handed over to the crooks. The show also explores the biggest anti-social issues troubling UK neighbourhoods and meets the local heroes using their own time and resources to tackle these problems head on

programme.desc:
As the CID reopen an investigation into three murders from 1973, DCI Paul Bethell tries to piece together a past that has haunted both him and a community for almost 30 years. They decide to head to Clinton's house, but on the way bump into fellow PCSO Kieran Price who questions their very shaky story about why they're caked in mud. programme.desc: False Diagnosis: The ADHD Scandal - Panorama: There has been a sharp increase in the number of adults who think they have attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. The NHS has been overwhelmed, and thousands are turning to private clinics for assessment instead. Rory Carson poses as a patient to reveal some clinics charging large fees for a short online consultation, and evidence suggesting diagnoses are being handed out to almost everyone who books an appointment. The programme also reveals clinics prescribing powerful drugs without carrying out proper checks

programme.desc:

Horologist Steve Fletcher and leather expert Suzie Fletcher are brought a century-old watch by Nancy who's father was awarded the watch for his bravery on his return from the First World War. Upholsterer Sonnaz Nooranvary takes on a rocking chair that has been at the heart of Anna's family home for decades and is in desperate need of some TLC. programme.title: Matt Willis: Fighting Addiction
programme.desc: Bassist and co-founder of Busted Matt Willis opens up about his experiences battling drug and alcohol addiction and his daily struggle to stay clean and sober. He speaks on the constant fear of relapse and the pressure it puts on himself and his family. Matt looks back on his past and his darkest days, trying to get to the root of his addictions. He visits a rehab unit that made a real difference to his recovery to speak with experts about why he and fellow addicts become dependent on drugs and alcohol before travelling to Imperial College London to meet a research team who are studying the differences in the brains of people with addictions and people without

A painting depicting the Lebanese city of Beirut arrives at the barn. It was painted by Nonny Jackson-Twist's grandfather just after the Second World War. programme.desc: False Diagnosis: The ADHD Scandal - Panorama: There has been a sharp increase in the number of adults who think they have attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. The NHS has been overwhelmed, and thousands are turning to private clinics for assessment instead. Rory Carson poses as a patient to reveal some clinics charging large fees for a short online consultation, and evidence suggesting diagnoses are being handed out to almost everyone who books an appointment. The programme also reveals clinics prescribing powerful drugs without carrying out proper checks

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Rav Wilding uses cutting-edge technology to monitor scammers' phone calls, to try and stop the victims losing out to real-time scams. The show also explores the biggest anti-social issues troubling UK neighbourhoods and meets the local heroes using their own time and resources to tackle these problems head on

programme.desc:

They decide to head to Clinton's house, but on the way bump into fellow PCSO Kieran Price who questions their very shaky story about why they're caked in mud. programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: False Diagnosis: The ADHD Scandal - Panorama: There has been a sharp increase in the number of adults who think they have attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. The NHS has been overwhelmed, and thousands are turning to private clinics for assessment instead. Rory Carson poses as a patient to reveal some clinics charging large fees for a short online consultation, and evidence suggesting diagnoses are being handed out to almost everyone who books an appointment. The programme also reveals clinics prescribing powerful drugs without carrying out proper checks

programme.desc: Rav Wilding uses cutting-edge technology to monitor scammers' phone calls, to try and stop the victims losing out to real-time scams. It's then a race against the criminals to contact the victim and intercept the scam before any money is handed over to the crooks. The remaining 14 chefs kick off Knockout Week by being split into two groups. The first group of seven cook a dish that they would have on the menu of their own restaurant or pop-up, or would feature in their cookbook. Guest judge Anna Haugh joins John Torode to decide which five will go on to cook at a restaurant and which two will be going home. The remaining five head to Kings Cross in London to work at Decimo under chef Peter Sanchez-Iglesias. During a busy lunch service, the five amateurs will be entirely responsible for serving the restaurant's menu to paying customers

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Jay Blades and his team of experts meet Liz from Dorset who brings in a crumbling cast-iron gate built by her brother as a gift for her and her late husband. Horologist Steve Fletcher and leather expert Suzie Fletcher are brought a century-old watch by Nancy who's father was awarded the watch for his bravery on his return from the First World War. Upholsterer Sonnaz Nooranvary takes on a rocking chair that has been at the heart of Anna's family home for decades and is in desperate need of some TLC. Last into the shop is Ruth and her Auntie Roz who bring in a penny arcade game from the 1920s
S06E14

programme.title: Matt Willis: Fighting Addiction
programme.desc: Bassist and co-founder of Busted Matt Willis opens up about his experiences battling drug and alcohol addiction and his daily struggle to stay clean and sober. He speaks on the constant fear of relapse and the pressure it puts on himself and his family. Matt looks back on his past and his darkest days, trying to get to the root of his addictions. He visits a rehab unit that made a real difference to his recovery to speak with experts about why he and fellow addicts become dependent on drugs and alcohol before travelling to Imperial College London to meet a research team who are studying the differences in the brains of people with addictions and people without

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
A painting depicting the Lebanese city of Beirut arrives at the barn. It was painted by Nonny Jackson-Twist's grandfather just after the Second World War. He would very much like to hang the painting in his home, but it's faded, the canvas cracked and in some sections the paint is flaking away. However, fine art conservator Lucia Scalisi is only too happy to take on this monumental task. Also being restored are pair of silver Shabbat candlesticks and a dilapidated car jack. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: London to Brighton: Side By Side
programme.desc: In 1953, the BBC commissioned a recording filmed from the point-of-view of a London to Brighton train. In 1983, another film of the same journey was recorded. This short programme presents these two iconic recordings side-by-side, demonstrating how both locomotive technology and the landscape have evolved over the years

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Chinatown to Gardens by the Bay: Michael Portillo is in the island city-state of Singapore on the last leg of his 2,500-mile exploration of south-east Asia. In Tai Seng he marvels at the world's largest subterranean rail depot where self-driving MRT trains are operated. He then takes a cable car to the island of Sentosa where he learns about one of Britain's worst military defeats and the brutal Japanese occupation that followed. At the Singapore Stock Exchange, Michael appreciates the island's success as a financial centre and, in the residential district of Ang Mo Kio, visits an urban farm of the future - on a car park roof
S01E20

programme.title: Ken Dodd's Liverpool Walkabout
programme.desc: A tour of Liverpool with comedian Ken Dodd, a proud lifelong resident of the city's Knotty Ash district

programme.title: Ken Dodd: How Tickled We Were
programme.desc: A celebration of the life and work of the comedian, recounting his life from his boyhood growing up in the 1930s in Knotty Ash through to his big break and continued career in showbusiness. Dodd's career spanned 50 years and after his rapid rise to stardom, he maintained his presence via countless television and radio shows, theatre tours and summer seasons with work ranging from pantomime to Shakespeare. He also enjoyed a spell as a successful recording artist and remained active until just a few months before his death aged 90. This programme features contributions from his friends and colleagues and includes an interview with his widow Anne

programme.title: The Shawshank Redemption (1994)
programme.desc: A banker is wrongly jailed for his wife's murder and over the course of a life sentence he forms a close friendship with a fellow inmate. He also earns a position of trust as book-keeper to the corrupt prison governor - but makes an enemy of his benefactor as he tries to clear his name. Frank Darabont's drama, starring Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, Bob Gunton, William Sadler, Clancy Brown and Gil Bellows

programme.title: Film Stars Don't Die in Liverpool (2017)
programme.desc: Real life proves to be just as dramatic off-screen as it does on it for ageing Hollywood superstar Gloria Grahame and her much younger lover, Peter Turner. As their mismatched romance waxes and wanes over time, events conspire to keep them in each other's lives even when it proves to be difficult and demanding. Romantic drama, starring Jamie Bell and Annette Bening

programme.title: Deep Ocean
programme.desc:
Deep Ocean: Giants of the Antarctic Deep: Documentary about the first scientific research undertaken in a submersible in the Antarctic. Three marine biologists use customised UHD cameras to capture ling the extraordinary forms of life that thrive in the Southern Ocean on film. Narrated by David Attenborough
S01E04

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Chinatown to Gardens by the Bay: Michael Portillo is in the island city-state of Singapore on the last leg of his 2,500-mile exploration of south-east Asia. In Tai Seng he marvels at the world's largest subterranean rail depot where self-driving MRT trains are operated. He then takes a cable car to the island of Sentosa where he learns about one of Britain's worst military defeats and the brutal Japanese occupation that followed. At the Singapore Stock Exchange, Michael appreciates the island's success as a financial centre and, in the residential district of Ang Mo Kio, visits an urban farm of the future - on a car park roof
S01E20

programme.title: Ken Dodd's Liverpool Walkabout
programme.desc: A tour of Liverpool with comedian Ken Dodd, a proud lifelong resident of the city's Knotty Ash district

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc:
Adventure & Exploration: Broadcaster David Dimbleby sails his yacht Rocket around the British coastline, exploring different aspects of the nation's maritime history, art and architecture along the way. He begins by sailing the south-west coast of Devon and Cornwall, where he tells the story of Sir Francis Drake and an array of adventurers, explorers, pirates and smugglers. He also welcomes record-breaking solo yachtswoman Ellen MacArthur on board and learns about one of the oldest maritime art forms of all - the tattoo, before agreeing to have one himself
S01E01

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 08/09/1994: East 17 singers Brian Harvey and Tony Mortimer present chart hits from September 8, 1994, featuring Blondie, Corona, the Wonder Stuff, Cyndi Lauper, Oasis, Pet Shop Boys, Kylie Minogue, Bon Jovi, Wet Wet Wet and Whigfield

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Simon Mayo introduces studio performances and videos from September 15, 1994, featuring Sophie B Hawkins, the Grid, Lisa Loeb and Nine Stories, M-Beat featuring General Levy, REM, Sinead O'Connor, Elvis Presley, Luther Vandross and Mariah Carey, Whigfield and Simple Minds

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 08/05/1986: Featuring performances by Patti LaBelle and Michael McDonald, Spitting Image, Billy Ocean, Falco and Whitney Houston. Presented by Janice Long and John Peel. From 8 May 1986

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 14/05/1992: Mark Franklin and Claudia Simon host the edition first aired on May 14 1992. Featuring performances by Shakespears Sister, the Wedding Present, Del Amitri, Kris Kross, En Vogue, Celine Dion and Peabo Bryson, CeCe Peniston and KWS

programme.title: Paul McCartney at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of TV appearances from the musician's post-Beatles career, featuring performances of songs including Band on the Run, Jet, Coming Up and Live and Let Die on programmes from Top of the Pops to the Electric Proms. There is also rarely seen backstage footage and interviews, as well as appearances by a range of familiar faces, including a recent encounter with die-hard Beatles fan Bob Mortimer

programme.title: Rock Family Trees
programme.desc:
The Mersey Sound: Rock Family Trees: The Liverpool music scene of the 1960s, an era synonymous with the band that changed the face of pop music - the Beatles. Pete Frame narrates the story of such bands including the Searchers, Gerry and the Pacemakers, Billy J Kramer, the Swinging Blue Jeans and the Merseybeats
S01E06

programme.title: Everything: The Real Thing Story
programme.desc: The rise of four working class boys from one of Liverpool's toughest neighbourhoods, who fought hardship and discrimination to become the biggest-selling black group in British pop history. With a string of hits, they dominated the international charts throughout the 1970s with iconic songs like You to Me Are Everything, Can't Get by Without You, and Can You Feel the Force. Hpwever the group's meteoric success was also tempered with personal tragedy, drug addiction and racial prejudice. Narrated by Jacob Anderson

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 08/09/1994: East 17 singers Brian Harvey and Tony Mortimer present chart hits from September 8, 1994, featuring Blondie, Corona, the Wonder Stuff, Cyndi Lauper, Oasis, Pet Shop Boys, Kylie Minogue, Bon Jovi, Wet Wet Wet and Whigfield

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Simon Mayo introduces studio performances and videos from September 15, 1994, featuring Sophie B Hawkins, the Grid, Lisa Loeb and Nine Stories, M-Beat featuring General Levy, REM, Sinead O'Connor, Elvis Presley, Luther Vandross and Mariah Carey, Whigfield and Simple Minds

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 08/05/1986: Featuring performances by Patti LaBelle and Michael McDonald, Spitting Image, Billy Ocean, Falco and Whitney Houston. Presented by Janice Long and John Peel. From 8 May 1986

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 14/05/1992: Mark Franklin and Claudia Simon host the edition first aired on May 14 1992. Featuring performances by Shakespears Sister, the Wedding Present, Del Amitri, Kris Kross, En Vogue, Celine Dion and Peabo Bryson, CeCe Peniston and KWS

programme.title: Sahara with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Dire Straits: The actor embarks on the last leg of his journey, passing through the dramatic mountains of the Hoggar Massif, visiting Libya and crossing into Tunisia, where he relives the filming of The Life of Brian. He also visits Algiers and the Spanish enclave of Ceuta before finishing the expedition where he started - Gibraltar
S01E04

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Annapurna to Everest: In the village of Lekhani in Nepal, Michael watches potential Gurkha recruits being put through their paces. He then commences the 4,200m ascent to Annapurna Base Camp to help him acclimatise. Next he heads off to Kathmandu to fulfil a regal engagement at the king's palace during the sacred festival of Desain, and observes holy men at the Siva shrine of Pashupatinath
S01E03

programme.title: Inspector Montalbano
programme.desc:
The Catalanotti Method: Feature-length final episode of the Italian crime drama. Montalbano grapples with the murder of the leader of an amateur dramatics company whose peculiar take on theatre borders on fanaticism. His assailant stabbed him in the chest, but without leaving a trace of blood. Might the key to discovering the identity of the killer be bound up in Catalanotti's disturbing conception of the stage? In Italian
S15E01

programme.title: The Bermuda Triangle: Beneath the Waves
programme.desc: Bruce Denardo explores the legend of the region where many planes and ships have disappeared in mysterious circumstances. Using a state-of-the-art submarine, Graham Hawkes reveals how five wrecks ended up 730ft down in the heart of the deadly expanse of water

programme.title: David Attenborough: A Life on Air
programme.desc: In 1952, David Attenborough was turned down for a job with BBC radio, only to end up working for the corporation's fledgling TV service - eventually becoming director of programmes. Since then he has become one of the most respected wildlife film-makers in the business, fronting classic series such as Life on Earth, The Blue Planet and Planet Earth. He talks to Michael Palin about his half-century at the corporation

programme.title: Sykes
programme.desc:
Stranger: Eric and Hattie are visited by a stranger who has returned to honour a promise made in his childhood. Vintage comedy first shown in 1972, guest starring Peter Sellers alongside Hattie Jacques and Eric Sykes
S01E06

programme.title: Sykes
programme.desc:
Spy Ring: Eric and Hattie become suspicious of their vodka-swilling, well-off new neighbours. Vintage comedy, starring Eric Sykes and Hattie Jacques
S02E03

programme.title: Eric Sykes: One of the Great Troupers
programme.desc: The veteran comedian takes to the stage of the Theatre Royal, Lincoln, where he gives a tongue-in-cheek account of his follies and fortunes as an actor, gag writer and comedian in theatre, radio and TV. He also pays tribute to Hattie Jacques and Richard Watts, the co-stars of his long-running Sykes sitcom, and there are appearances from Eddie Lester, John Evans and Tony Hayes

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Annapurna to Everest: In the village of Lekhani in Nepal, Michael watches potential Gurkha recruits being put through their paces. He then commences the 4,200m ascent to Annapurna Base Camp to help him acclimatise. Next he heads off to Kathmandu to fulfil a regal engagement at the king's palace during the sacred festival of Desain, and observes holy men at the Siva shrine of Pashupatinath
S01E03

programme.title: Francesco's Italy: Top to Toe
programme.desc:
The Land of My Mother: Francesco da Mosto concludes his travels in the south of Italy, where his family has lived for 500 years. He explores the rock caves of Matera, attends Nocera's Easter celebrations and finds out about collapsible houses designed to help the residents avoid paying taxes. He also visits Sicily, where he takes a trip to Mount Etna and the catacombs of Palermo
S01E04

programme.title: The Tragedy of Macbeth
programme.desc: James McArdle and Saoirse Ronan star in this critically acclaimed production of the Shakespeare play about one couple's spine-chilling quest for power, directed by YaÃ«l Farber and captured during its 2021 run at the Almeida Theatre. In the ruins of a theatre, three witches make a prophecy. A warrior and his wife enter the darkness. A war begins

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc:
Gilbert and George: No Surrender - Imagine: Alan Yentob examines the work of controversial artists Gilbert and George as they prepare for the opening of their recent retrospective at the Tate Modern. This intimate portrait considers how the pair's working relationship functions and also includes a look inside their East End home, where they have lived for the past 40 years
S2007E01

programme.title: Ian Hislop's Fake News: A True History
programme.desc: The Private Eye editor explores the history of dishonest news reporting over the past 200 years, investigating how the rivalry between press barons Joseph Pulitzer and William Randolph Hearst may have contributed to an actual war. The programme also looks at the influence of technology, from early trick photography to modern deepfakes, and features the owner of a Washington pizza parlour who has been on the receiving end of one of the modern world's most infamous conspiracy theories

programme.title: Berlin 1945
programme.desc:
The second episode looks at the final downfall of the Nazi regime following Hitler's suicide and the disassembling of the Wehrmacht, and examines how life changed for the people of Berlin under occupation by the victorious Soviet army
S01E02

programme.title: Francesco's Italy: Top to Toe
programme.desc:
The Land of My Mother: Francesco da Mosto concludes his travels in the south of Italy, where his family has lived for 500 years. He explores the rock caves of Matera, attends Nocera's Easter celebrations and finds out about collapsible houses designed to help the residents avoid paying taxes. He also visits Sicily, where he takes a trip to Mount Etna and the catacombs of Palermo
S01E04

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc:
Travellers: Chris takes a look at nature's best navigators, with mule deer building up complicated memory maps of their landscapes so they don't get lost, while elephants rely on the knowledge of the herd's matriarch to find precious waterholes. Dung beetles plot routes by reading the stars, while the mantis shrimp has one of the most complex navigation systems in the natural world. For many species of fish and birds, there's safety in numbers and they often travel in vast shoals and flocks - but who leads the way, and how do they decide?
S01E06

programme.title: Paul Merson: A Walk Through My Life
programme.desc: The football pundit and former Arsenal and England midfielder walks through North Yorkshire, reflecting on his life, career and faith. Carrying a 360-degree camera, he also describes his struggles with drink and gambling addiction

programme.title: Mindful Escapes: Breathe, Release, Restore
programme.desc:
Breathe: Mindfulness expert Andy Puddicombe reveals why breathing is so important to becoming still and being in the moment, illustrated with natural history footage
S01E01

programme.title: Life of a Mountain: A Year on Helvellyn
programme.desc: Documentary capturing a year in the life of the Lake District's most popular peak, featuring insights from those that live by, care for and visit the mountain

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: The team explores the threat of an asteroid impact on earth and meet space scientists who are developing methods of planetary defence that sound like the stuff of science fiction. Maggie meets Professor Alan Fitzsimmons, expert in asteroid observation, to learn how the latest technology monitors near-Earth asteroids. He explains which ones are a current concern, and why we missed the dangerous Chelyabinsk meteor - a 9,000-ton fireball that exploded in the sky above Russia

programme.title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway
programme.desc:
Under Pressure, Over Budget - Part One: Part one of two. Following the final stages of the construction work on the new Elizabeth Line underground railway beneath the streets of London. Cameras follow the engineers, technicians and train staff who are under pressure to complete their section of the project, including building and fitting out 10 brand new stations, learning to drive the new fleet of trains, and testing the 21km twin tunnels beneath London, in a bid to make it safe for the public
S03E01

programme.title: Building Britain's Biggest Nuclear Power Station
programme.desc:
Part one of two. Following the challenges involved with building the Hinkley Point C in the remote Somerset countryside, the first new nuclear power station in Britain for a generation. This series follows the engineers, technicians, and the behind-the-scenes staff who are under pressure to keep the project on track, including building the mammoth foundations for the two nuclear reactors, and excavating cooling water tunnels out under the Bristol Channel
S01E01

programme.title: H2O: The Molecule That Made Us
programme.desc:
Civilisations: The documentary travels to the jungles of the Congo on the trail of a theory that water was at the centre of how humans first stood upright. In Egypt and China, an investigation shows how civilisations were shaped by their relationship to the great rivers, and in Mexico, the programme reveals how access to underground water changed humanity's footprint on the planet
S01E02

programme.title: Novels That Shaped Our World
programme.desc:
The Empire Writes Back: The second documentary examining fictional writing from three different perspectives considers the subject of race and colonialism. It looks at books including Robinson Crusoe, the first novel ever published in English, in 1719, whose hero was a slave trader, and two famous American novels published more than a century apart - Harriet Beecher Stowe's Uncle Tom's Cabin and Toni Morrison's Beloved. The programme also comes up to date with titles such as Malorie Blackman's Noughts and Crosses and Paul Beatty's The Sell Out
S01E02

programme.title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway
programme.desc:
Under Pressure, Over Budget - Part One: Part one of two. Following the final stages of the construction work on the new Elizabeth Line underground railway beneath the streets of London. Cameras follow the engineers, technicians and train staff who are under pressure to complete their section of the project, including building and fitting out 10 brand new stations, learning to drive the new fleet of trains, and testing the 21km twin tunnels beneath London, in a bid to make it safe for the public
S03E01

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
Time: Liz McIvor explores how Britain's expanding rail network was the spark to a social revolution, starting in the 1800s and continuing through to modern times. She begins by examining the introduction of precise railway schedules and timetables that recognised Greenwich Mean Time. However, in a country made up of separate local time zones, with clocks in the west set several minutes behind those in the east, not everyone was keen to step in line
S01E01

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc:
Steaming Down the Road: Fred looks at early experiments in the use of steam for road transport, more than 100 years before the invention of the petrol engine. Plus, an insight into the development of the traction engine for agriculture and haulage
S01E04

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
Misunderstandings: A chance encounter leads to an invitation for Jean to stay at her sister-in-law's home, but she has to persuade Lionel to accompany her. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer
S02E05

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc:
Moving On: Bob takes Terry on a tour of their old haunts - only to reveal most of them have been demolished. Terry finds it difficult accepting that times have changed during his time away - and a job interview proves the last straw. Classic comedy, with James Bolam and Rodney Bewes
S01E04

programme.title: Dam Busters Declassified
programme.desc: Actor Martin Shaw takes to the skies in a bid to separate the facts from the myths surrounding the famous 1943 raid by 617 Squadron, which used bouncing bombs to attack German dams. He also talks to the last living RAF veteran of the mission, as well as to a survivor of the flooding caused by the breaching of the Moehne dam, and meets the secret wartime girlfriend of pilot Guy Gibson

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary-maker Bat-dor Ojalvo is given extraordinary access to one of Israel's most Orthodox Hasidic communities to explore the scandal that erupted when the rabbi who established and led the community died. There follows a story of inheritance battles, violent reprisals, sexual abuse and underage marriages, told by those that experienced it

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc:
Invasion & Defence: David Dimbleby continues his voyage around Britain, sailing his yacht Rocket along coastal regions of the South East, the first point of attack for enemy forces and therefore essential to the nation's defence throughout history. Along the way, he takes a tour of HMS Victory, Nelson's flagship vessel from the Battle of Trafalgar, lovingly preserved in dry dock in Portsmouth. He also meets a carpenter who still makes wooden figureheads, discovers how a chamber pot acted as propaganda in the battle against Napoleon and reveals the way abstract art was used to deceive German submarine pilots
S01E02

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
Time: Liz McIvor explores how Britain's expanding rail network was the spark to a social revolution, starting in the 1800s and continuing through to modern times. She begins by examining the introduction of precise railway schedules and timetables that recognised Greenwich Mean Time. However, in a country made up of separate local time zones, with clocks in the west set several minutes behind those in the east, not everyone was keen to step in line
S01E01

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc:
Steaming Down the Road: Fred looks at early experiments in the use of steam for road transport, more than 100 years before the invention of the petrol engine. Plus, an insight into the development of the traction engine for agriculture and haulage
S01E04

programme.title: Dam Busters Declassified
programme.desc: Actor Martin Shaw takes to the skies in a bid to separate the facts from the myths surrounding the famous 1943 raid by 617 Squadron, which used bouncing bombs to attack German dams. He also talks to the last living RAF veteran of the mission, as well as to a survivor of the flooding caused by the breaching of the Moehne dam, and meets the secret wartime girlfriend of pilot Guy Gibson

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc:
Invasion & Defence: David Dimbleby continues his voyage around Britain, sailing his yacht Rocket along coastal regions of the South East, the first point of attack for enemy forces and therefore essential to the nation's defence throughout history. Along the way, he takes a tour of HMS Victory, Nelson's flagship vessel from the Battle of Trafalgar, lovingly preserved in dry dock in Portsmouth. He also meets a carpenter who still makes wooden figureheads, discovers how a chamber pot acted as propaganda in the battle against Napoleon and reveals the way abstract art was used to deceive German submarine pilots
S01E02

programme.title: Great Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Crewe to Crewe: Victoria Wood makes a round trip of northern England and Scotland starting at Crewe. She visits Carnforth Station, where David Lean shot the memorable location scenes in Brief Encounter, takes a sleeper train from Glasgow to Fort William and stops off at a railway museum in an enthusiast's back garden
S03E01

programme.title: Victoria Wood: A Bafta Tribute
programme.desc: Julie Walters, Lenny Henry, Richard E Grant and Jim Broadbent gather for a gala honouring the much-loved entertainer, with contributions from Peter Kay and French and Saunders. The celebration offers an opportunity to look back over her career with a combination of celebrity tributes and clips of her work, culminating with the presentation of the Bafta award

programme.title: Victoria Wood: The Secret List
programme.desc:
With a career spanning more than 40 years and crossing every possible genre, Victoria Wood amassed a back catalogue bulging with sublime comedy moments. The first of two documentaries offers a unique opportunity to see the very best bits of Victoria's work that she loved the most, drawing on some of the 20 sketches chosen by her in a notebook discovered after her death. Plus, contributors including Russell T Davies, Ken Loach, Winsome Pinnock, Jane Wymark and Joan Armatrading discuss Victoria's broad catalogue of award-winning comedy. Narrated by Sara Pascoe
S01E01

programme.title: Duncan Preston Remembers - Pat and Margaret
programme.desc: The actor looks back at Victoria Wood's 1994 comedy drama about a successful actress and her dowdy sister reunited after 27 years apart on a TV show

programme.title: Pat and Margaret
programme.desc: A Lancashire-born American soap star visits Britain on a publicity tour, and is horrified when a live TV show organises a reunion with a motorway cafeteria waitress who happens to be her long-lost sister. Comedy drama, written by and starring Victoria Wood, with Julie Walters, Celia Imrie, Duncan Preston and Thora Hird

programme.title: Victoria Wood: The Secret List
programme.desc:
With a career spanning more than 40 years and crossing every possible genre, Victoria Wood amassed a back catalogue bulging with sublime comedy moments. This second of two programmes draws on further favourite sketches chosen by her in a notebook discovered after her death. Plus, contributors discuss her broad catalogue of award-winning comedy
S01E02

programme.title: Victoria Wood: A Personal View - Scene
programme.desc: The writer and comedian discusses her career and her writing, and gives a glimpse of life backstage on her stand-up tour. First broadcast in 1985

programme.title: Mindful Escapes: Breathe, Release, Restore
programme.desc:
Breathe: Mindfulness expert Andy Puddicombe reveals why breathing is so important to becoming still and being in the moment, illustrated with natural history footage
S01E01

programme.desc:
